issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim
X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw: I was unable to reproduce this problem. Publishing on X3/cmd_vel or X4/cmd_vel works for me. Can you check if you have the latest docker image? Also, could you run `rqt_graph` and attach the image? It would be helpful to see if there any missing nodes.
content.html: I was unable to reproduce this problem. Publishing on X3/cmd_vel or X4/cmd_vel works for me. Can you check if you have the latest docker image? Also, could you run rqt_graph and attach the image? It would be helpful to see if there any missing nodes.

issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
I rebuilt everything and ran again. Same problem. Everything seems to be connected on the ROS side from what I can tell \(cmd\_vel → ros1\_ign\_bridge\_twist\). It does not appear that individual rotor commands are being piped anywhere though. I should still be on the tunnel\_circuit branch, correct?

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2912117380-overall.jpg)
‌

also:

```
arthur@arthur-XPS-15-9570:~/subt_hello_world/docker$ rostopic info /charlie/cmd_vel 
Type: geometry_msgs/Twist

Publishers: 
 * /charlie/ros1_ign_bridge_twist (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:33905/)
 * /charlie_vel (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:37199/)

Subscribers: 
 * /charlie/ros1_ign_bridge_twist (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:33905/)
 * /charlie/cmdvel_transform (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:45333/)

Type: mav_msgs/Actuators

 * /charlie/roll_pitch_yawrate_thrust_controller_node (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:38949/)

Subscribers: None

```

If you can’t reproduce this I’ll just remove the entrypoint for the local cloudsim simulator and start it from an interactive shell so I can investigate on the Ignition side.

issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
As you said, it looks like the ros1_ign bridge for the `command/motor_speed` topic is missing from your setup. I'm still unable to reproduce. Are you using the image from docker hub? 

This is what I did to test:

```
$ ./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=bravo robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=charlie robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName4:=delta robotConfig4:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

```


This is option 2 from #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub

In a different terminal

```
$ containerid=$(docker ps -aqf ancestor=nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed:latest) && echo $containerid
$ docker exec --privileged -e DISPLAY=${DISPLAY} -e LINES="`tput lines`" -it ${containerid} bash
$ rqt_graph

```

Here's my graph for comparison:
![rosgraph.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3935035184-rosgraph.png)
content.html:
As you said, it looks like the ros1_ign bridge for the command/motor_speed topic is missing from your setup. I'm still unable to reproduce. Are you using the image from docker hub?

This is what I did to test:

$ ./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=bravo robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=charlie robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName4:=delta robotConfig4:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1

This is option 2 from #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/SystemSetupDockerhub

In a different terminal

$ containerid=$(docker ps -aqf ancestor=nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed:latest) && echo $containerid
$ docker exec --privileged -e DISPLAY=${DISPLAY} -e LINES="`tput lines`" -it ${containerid} bash
$ rqt_graph

Here's my graph for comparison:

issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
Ok, I figured out why you’re not able to reproduce this:

When I run the simulation as you describe, \(i.e. directly from the updated SubT image\) it works \(`./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=bravo robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=charlie robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName4:=delta robotConfig4:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`\)

However, whenever I run Cloudsim Local in two components \(cloudsim\_sim and cloudsim\_bridge\) from this guide: [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim) I can reproduce my issue \(and I suspect you will be able to reproduce this when you run it this way\).

Is the SubT image `nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed` intended to completely replace the method for running Cloudsim locally? It seems to contain both the simulation and the bridges and could be a replacement candidate.
content.html:
Ok, I figured out why you’re not able to reproduce this:

When I run the simulation as you describe, (i.e. directly from the updated SubT image) it works (./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign robotName1:=alpha robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName2:=bravo robotConfig2:=X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName3:=charlie robotConfig3:=X3_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotName4:=delta robotConfig4:=X4_SENSOR_CONFIG_1)

However, whenever I run Cloudsim Local in two components (cloudsim_sim and cloudsim_bridge) from this guide: #!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim I can reproduce my issue (and I suspect you will be able to reproduce this when you run it this way).

Is the SubT image nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed intended to completely replace the method for running Cloudsim locally? It seems to contain both the simulation and the bridges and could be a replacement candidate.

issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw: I'm able to reproduce the issue using cloudsim_sim and cloudsim_bridge. I believe I know the issue ~~and will create a PR shortly~~ #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/235/add-missing-uav-parameter/diff.
content.html: I'm able to reproduce the issue using cloudsim_sim and cloudsim_bridge. I believe I know the issue and will create a PR shortly #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/235/add-missing-uav-parameter/diff.

issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
Pulled down the subt-repo and rebuilt, it works. Go ahead and mark this as **resolved.**

I suppose you’re moving almost exclusively to released images with specific tags. Maybe the documentation should change on the local cloudsim page to reflect this \([#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim)\) so that people pull images as the first option while leaving the build scripts for debugging in the subt repository.

The built and tagged DockerHub is a really adaptation for simplifying and reducing the amount of time for competitors to setup and remain up to date.
content.html:
Pulled down the subt-repo and rebuilt, it works. Go ahead and mark this as resolved.

I suppose you’re moving almost exclusively to released images with specific tags. Maybe the documentation should change on the local cloudsim page to reflect this (#!/osrf/subt/wiki/tutorials/cloudsim) so that people pull images as the first option while leaving the build scripts for debugging in the subt repository.

The built and tagged DockerHub is a really adaptation for simplifying and reducing the amount of time for competitors to setup and remain up to date.

issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
By the way, I just tried running `nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest` and it does not appear that the “cloudsim\_sim\_latest” tag has isolated that image as I can view rostopics outside of the docker image without using the `nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest` and I can even run the the simple solution on it without launching anything regarding `cloudsim_bridge`. Is this intended?

‌

I’m not sure how much impact this has for development to ensure this is 100% working but if I’m trying to imagine a world in which I want to recreate the isolated development architecture this would impact that. but there are other hurdles I would need to go through to setup a fully isolated development architecture.

‌

To set this up for psuedo-isolation \(no shared ROS topics\) I would need to run the `cloudsim_sim` and then `cloudsim_bridge` per separate robot on separate ROS\_MASTER ports for each robot to isolate topics/tf. Some parameters would probably be required for this to fed on the command line launch for the entrypoint.
content.html:
By the way, I just tried running nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest and it does not appear that the “cloudsim_sim_latest” tag has isolated that image as I can view rostopics outside of the docker image without using the nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest and I can even run the the simple solution on it without launching anything regarding cloudsim_bridge. Is this intended?

‌

I’m not sure how much impact this has for development to ensure this is 100% working but if I’m trying to imagine a world in which I want to recreate the isolated development architecture this would impact that. but there are other hurdles I would need to go through to setup a fully isolated development architecture.

‌

To set this up for psuedo-isolation (no shared ROS topics) I would need to run the cloudsim_sim and then cloudsim_bridge per separate robot on separate ROS_MASTER ports for each robot to isolate topics/tf. Some parameters would probably be required for this to fed on the command line launch for the entrypoint.

content.raw: Good catch, I was not.  I was using \`tunnel\_circuit\_practice.ign\` still, not quite sure why I assumed the image was the isolation as opposed to the launch file.  It is isolated when I use the `cloudsim_sim.ign` launch file.
content.html: Good catch, I was not. I was using `tunnel_circuit_practice.ign` still, not quite sure why I assumed the image was the isolation as opposed to the launch file. It is isolated when I use the cloudsim_sim.ign launch file.
